result.execSummary:
The defendant Treasure E Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$200.00 BAIL APPLIED. Remaining balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Prescriptions must be prescribed by Defendant's doctor and only used in the amounts prescribed.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Defendant to have no contact with the Walmart store in Delafield, WI.
If Defendant successfully completes probation with no violations of rules; 
Expungement granted and will proceed by operation of law.

14CF494 was dismissed and read into 14CF232.

records.addlTxt: Based on minutes of sentencing hearing 9-22-2014.
Copy of medical document.

Attorney Katie Beth Bricco in court.   Defendant Treasure E Perkins did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 2:37 pm.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts.  Court revokes and forfeits bail. 

Court recalls case at 3:32 pm Attorney Katie Beth Bricco in court.   Defendant Treasure E Perkins now appears.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court vacate the order of bail forfeiture, previously ordered on April 16, 2014.

Court orders the following: 
Count 1:
- 120 Days Jail straight time (13 days credit) STAYED for 18 months Probation
- Court costs of $268.00;apply bail.
- DNA fee of $250.00; apply bail.
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Prescriptions must be prescribed by defendant's doctor and only used in the amounts prescribed.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. DNA Sample if not yet provided. Defendant to have no contact with the Walmart store in Delafield, WI.  
 
If defendant successfully completes probation with no violations of rules; Expungement granted and will proceed by operation of law.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
